metadata.title: CVE-2016-2222 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The wp_http_validate_url function in wp-includes/http.php in WordPressbefore 4.4.2 allows remote attackers to conduct server-side request forgery(SSRF) attacks via a zero value in the first octet of an IPv4 address inthe u parameter to wp-admin/press-this.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.4.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.4.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.4.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 4.4.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.4.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.2+dfsg-1').
